quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Survival and Devil
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, beliefs, satan. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the historic attack on Normandy on June 6, 1944, which was part of World War II military operations of the Allied Powers against Nazi Germany?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Operation Neptune

questions.question: Bobby Leach, a circus stuntman from Cornwell, England, famous for surviving a barrel ride over the Niagara Falls, died in what way?

options.text: He was one of the first casualties of WWI.
He slipped on a orange peel and died.
He died during an attempt to swim the English Channel.
In 1912 he was aboard the Titanic and drowned.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He slipped on a orange peel and died.

questions.question: Turtles employ numerous survival techniques,  Which one is not among these natural devices for survival?

options.text: Their ability to breathe out of their mouth and out of their anus
Their shells, impervious to attacks by any animals other than humans
Their ability to live both on land and in the water
Their incredible orientation skills - they get back to lay eggs where they were born

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their shells, impervious to attacks by any animals other than humans

questions.question: What is the first name of the actress who played the main character on Maude?

This man established The Church of Satan. It is an organization that promotes an interesting form of Satanism - everyone views himself as his or her own god and is therefore responsible for his or her own destiny.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anton Szandor LaVey

questions.question: Suppose Mr. Jones works with ANOVA, regression lines, the sign-test, and the Gaussian distribution. What field of mathematics does Mr. Jones work in?
In the 1997 movie Devils Advocate, Keanu Reeves character, Kevin Lomax, starts work in John Miltons huge law firm. Which one of these actors played Milton?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Pacino

questions.question: What is the main symptom of the uncommon blood disorder, known as methemoglobinemia?

options.text: Faster breathing because of lack of haemoglobin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bluish complexion of the skin

questions.question: Which anatomical term defines the midline groove connecting the upper lip to the nose?
This word is used to denote a group of cobras.
According to Islamic beliefs, the Devil was created out of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Smokeless fire

questions.question: What device was invented in the early 1910s by American race-car driver, Ray Harroun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The rear view mirror

questions.question: The first novel of this Nobel Prize-winning author was called Lord of the Flies. The title is a literal English translation of one of the alternate names of the Devil -- Beelzebub.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Golding

questions.question: A mixture of water and honey can be used for what unconventional purpose?

options.text: A means of greasing a muffin pan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antifreeze for cars

questions.question: Which of these actions has remained in history as the first official act of President Abraham Lincolns new administration?

options.text: Giving Winfield Scott command of the US Army

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hiring a secretary named Nicolay

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: World and Devil
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, beliefs, deaths. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Austin, Texas is called The Live Music Capital of the World.
What is the maximum distance between Mars and the Sun?
What company is generally regarded as the largest toy distributor in the world?
Humans are the only species that make love face-to-face.
Once occupied by the Romans and then later the Vikings, which Yorkshire city is said to be the most haunted in Europe if not the world?

Not surprisingly, the Devil is a major Arcana Tarot card. The image on the card depicts a Satyr standing over two naked human-like demons, who are chained together. What is the interpretation of this Tarot card?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Self bondage

questions.question: What percent of movies released in theaters in 1985 were R-rated?
In Native American beliefs, humans could be transformed into a dangerous cannibalistic spirits if they ate human flesh. What is the name given to these creatures?

In this fifth novel in Anne Rices The Vampire Chronicles, Lestat is offered a job by the devil himself. The Devil explains to him many things about heaven and hell, and reveals some of the secrets of the world. What is the title of the novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Memnoch the Devil

questions.question: The Eiffel Tower is 6 inches taller in the summer than in the winter.
In Utah, wine used in wine tasting cannot be swallowed.
What book is said to be the most shoplifted?

options.text: National Geographic Atlas of the World

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bible

questions.question: Sympathy for the Devil is a song, originally released by this British rock band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: Which royal abode has had visitations from the ghosts of Thomas Becket, Anne Boleyn, King Henry VIII and Lady Jane Grey amongst many others (including a bear)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tower of London

questions.question: What animal is responsible for the most human deaths in the world?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Ghost and Following
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two famous ghosts supposedly haunt the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe and Montgomery Clift.

questions.question: In astronomy, what is a syzygy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An alignment of 3 celestial bodies

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the way Michelangelo drew the snake in the Sistine Chapel?

options.text: The snake appears to be speaking

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The snake is a woman

questions.question: Which one of the following is not said to be haunted by the ghost of Abraham Lincoln?

options.text: The family home in Springfield, Illinois.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lincoln Memorial.

questions.question: Which famous hoax of the early twentieth century fooled many including Sir Arthur Conan Doyle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cottingley Fairies.

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a Japanese ghost or spirit?
Is the Edgar Allen Poe House in Baltimore supposedly haunted by the ghost of the eponymous author?
What make of pistol did actor and Southern sympathizer John Wilkes Booth use to kill President Lincoln?
This seemingly lifelike substance is allegedly extruded from the bodies of mediums. It can be vaporous or solid and is said to smell of ozone. What is it?
What is the longest river in Asia  Minor?
Which of the following people was a big fan of bowling?
Reports of poltergeist activity date back as far as ancient Roman times.
The  protest march from Philadelphia to Teddy Roosevelts home in 1903 was called this.

options.text: The March of the Mill Children

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The March of the Mill Children

questions.question: Which of these celebrities was named after the Biblical character who was Namomis daughter-in-law?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oprah Winfrey

questions.question: Which was the first jazz single to sell one million copies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chattanooga Choo-Choo

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Tornado
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This ABC TV series showed the events in an American History class at the fictional Walt Whitman High School in Los Angeles.
The Black Sea is not connected to the Sea of Azov.
This country was formerly known as the Republic of Upper Volta. On August 4, 1984, President Thomas Sankara gave it a new name which means the land of upright people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burkina Faso

questions.question: Three of the four players have been recognized as Most Valuable Player of the Chicago White Sox, which bore the nickname The Chicago Black Sox for a while. Who is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzie Guillén

questions.question: This scale is used to measure the intensity of a tornado by examining the damage caused by the tornado, when passing over man-made structures.
It is generally accepted that this term, whose usage was reported by Newsweek in 1951, first appeared in Dr. Seusss book If I Ran the Zoo, where it names one of the comical, imaginary animals.
The concept of Men in Black (men dressed in black suits claiming to be government agents) can be observed in all of these movies except one.

This United States Army lieutenant general was in command of the American army at the beginning of the American Civil War. He developed the Union strategy popular as the Anaconda Plan, that would be used to defeat the Confederacy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winfield Scott

questions.question: Which famous actor was Arthur Millers son-in-law?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel  Day-Lewis

questions.question: This song, composed by George Harrison, one of the members of the Beatles, caused a plagiarism trial.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Sweet Lord

questions.question: This small agricultural town, whose motto is solidarity in work, is located in Quebec, Canada, near the St. Lawrence River.
Chuck Berry recorded this song in 1972 and used to call it My Alma Mater. Mary Whitehouse, a British morality campaigner, made an unsuccessful attempt to get the song banned.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Ding-a-Ling

questions.question: The album Paint it Black by the Rolling Stones was released in this year.
This popular African-American group was founded in 1954. Its original members -- OKelly, Rudolph, Ronald and Vernon were from Cincinnati, Ohio.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Isley Brothers

questions.question: The name of this company, founded by Fusajiro Yamauchi in 1889, roughly translates as leave luck to heaven.

questions.question: This force prevents anything from escaping black holes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gravity force

questions.question: The Hollywood production Meet Joe Black had 5 wins and 2 nominations.

Which form of cancer is the number one cause of cancer deaths in both men and women in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lung Cancer

questions.question: In the USA, what is the longest month?

According to Christianity, besides black magic, there is also white magic.
Which of these represents the largest group of soldiers?
In which city and state was the first motion picture created?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Orange, NJ

questions.question: Which of these conditions is the most common reason for a doctor to prescribe Lithium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bipolar disorder

questions.question: One of the following statements concerning black tea is wrong.

options.text: In Chinese, black tea is known as brown tea.
Its flavor is stronger than that of most other teas.
It is made from heavily oxidized leaves.
It contains more caffeine than other teas.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Chinese, black tea is known as brown tea.

questions.question: What was the first movie shown in the White House?

At one time both Canada and Ireland were governed by people of this same name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Robinson

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boardwalk and Park Place

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It already is plural

questions.question: Which of the following best describes heavy water?

options.text: Water with several isotopes of hydrogen
Water carrying silt down a river

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water with several isotopes of hydrogen

questions.question: Charles Darwin and this US president were born on the same day of the same year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kodiak bear

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Drew
